page.title: 13EGG PACKING & DISTRIBUTION
page.content: The Curwin Egg Packing Station has been in operation for about 20 years. 720,000 eggs per day arrive at the station.All the eggs which are delivered to the station are redistributed to the retailers on the same day so that they reach the customers while they are still fresh. To ensure that the eggs remain fresh whilst at the station the temperature is kept at 10 degrees C.To test for freshness a sample batch from each batch is weighed, cracked open onto a glass sheet & the height of the white measured.The eggs are tested for quality by being passed through a "candle machine".This is a cubicle which lights up the egg so that you can actually see inside the egg.All the eggs with cracks or other defects are then removed.The eggs are then graded & hand packed for distribution.
